articles.title: Sam Altman says ‘enough’ to questions about OpenAI’s revenue
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman recently said that the company is doing “well more” than $13 billion in annual revenue — and he sounded a little testy when pressed on how it will pay for its massive spending commitments.

articles.title: Meta has an AI product problem
articles.summary: Meta's AI spending is starting to make Wall Street nervous.

articles.title: Rising energy prices put AI and data centers in the crosshairs
articles.summary: A majority of consumers say they’re worried about data centers driving up electricity costs. Is the industry prepared for a possible backlash?

articles.title: AI researchers ’embodied’ an LLM into a robot – and it started channeling Robin Williams
articles.summary: AI researchers at Andon Labs embedded various LLMs in a vacuum robot to test how ready they were to be embodied. And hilarity ensued.

articles.title: AI mania tanks CoreWeave’s Core Scientific acquisition — it buys Python notebook Marimo
articles.summary: CoreWeave's failed buy of Core Scientific is another sign of an AI bubble. But it's still shopping.

articles.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
articles.summary: A timeline of ChatGPT product updates and releases, starting with the latest, which we’ve been updating throughout the year.

articles.title: Equity Live: From $300M seed rounds to data center builds, AI is feeling bubbly
articles.summary: The Equity crew was live at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025! articles.title: AWS exceeds Wall Street’s expectations as demand for cloud infra remains high
articles.summary: AWS continues to see strong demand as companies gobble up its cloud infrastructure services in the age of AI.

articles.title: Perplexity strikes multi-year licensing deal with Getty Images
articles.summary: Perplexity’s agreement with Getty appears to legitimize some of the startup’s previous use of Getty’s stock photos. Perplexity came under fire last year for a series of plagiarism accusations from several news organizations.

articles.title: Tim Cook says Apple is open to M&A on the AI front
articles.summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook noted in the company's Q4 2025 earnings call that Apple was preparing to announce more AI partnerships like the one it has with OpenAI to integrate ChatGPT into Siri and Apple Intelligence.

articles.title: The brain power behind sustainable AI
articles.summary: PhD student Miranda Schwacke explores how computing inspired by the human brain can fuel energy-efficient artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Five with MIT ties elected to National Academy of Medicine for 2025
articles.summary: Professors Facundo Batista and Dina Katabi, along with three additional MIT alumni, are honored for their outstanding professional achievement and commitment to service.

articles.title: Creating AI that matters
articles.summary: How the MIT-IBM Watson AI Lab is shaping AI-sociotechnical systems for the future.

articles.title: New software designs eco-friendly clothing that can reassemble into new items
articles.summary: To reduce waste, the Refashion program helps users create outlines for adaptable clothing, such as pants that can be reconfigured into a dress. Each component of these pieces can be replaced, rearranged, or restyled.

articles.title: Method teaches generative AI models to locate personalized objects
articles.summary: After being trained with this technique, vision-language models can better identify a unique item in a new scene.

articles.title: Remembering Professor Emerita Jeanne Shapiro  Bamberger, a pioneer in music education
articles.summary: The former department chair was an early innovator in the use of artificial intelligence to both study and influence how children learn music.

articles.title: Blending neuroscience, AI, and music to create mental health innovations
articles.summary: Media Lab PhD student Kimaya Lecamwasam researches how music can shape well-being.

articles.title: Optimizing food subsidies: Applying digital platforms to maximize nutrition
articles.summary: An algorithm can change the face of food assistance policy in the Global South, says MIT assistant professor and J-WAFS researcher Ali Aouad.

articles.title: Checking the quality of materials just got easier with a new AI tool
articles.summary: Acting as a “virtual spectrometer,” SpectroGen generates spectroscopic data in any modality, such as X-ray or infrared, to quickly assess a material’s quality.

articles.title: Helping scientists run complex data analyses without writing code
articles.summary: Co-founded by an MIT alumnus, Watershed Bio offers researchers who aren’t software engineers a way to run large-scale analyses to accelerate biology.

articles.title: Large reasoning models almost certainly can think
articles.summary: Recently, there has been a lot of hullabaloo about the idea that large reasoning models (LRM) are unable to think. articles.title: Why IT leaders should pay attention to Canva’s ‘imagination era’ strategy
articles.summary: The rise of AI marks a critical shift away from decades defined by information-chasing and a push for more and more compute power. Canva co-founder and CPO Cameron Adams refers to this dawning time as the “imagination era.” Meaning: Individuals and enterprises must be able to turn creativity into ac

articles.title: Meta researchers open the LLM black box to repair flawed AI reasoning
articles.summary: Researchers at Meta FAIR and the University of Edinburgh have developed a new technique that can predict the correctness of a large language model's (LLM) reasoning and even intervene to fix its mistakes. articles.summary: The vibe coding tool Cursor, from startup Anysphere, has introduced Composer, its first in-house, proprietary coding large language model (LLM) as part of its Cursor 2.0 platform update. articles.title: Geostar pioneers GEO as traditional SEO faces 25% decline from AI chatbots, Gartner says
articles.summary: The moment Mack McConnell knew everything about search had changed came last summer at the Paris Olympics. articles.title: From static classifiers to reasoning engines: OpenAI’s new model rethinks content moderation
articles.summary: Enterprises, eager to ensure any AI models they use adhere to safety and safe-use policies, fine-tune LLMs so they do not respond to unwanted queries. However, much of the safeguarding and red teaming happens before deployment, “baking in” policies before users fully test the models’ capabilities in

articles.title: Nvidia researchers unlock 4-bit LLM training that matches 8-bit performance
articles.summary: Researchers at Nvidia have developed a novel approach to train large language models (LLMs) in 4-bit quantized format while maintaining their stability and accuracy at the level of high-precision models. Their technique, NVFP4, makes it possible to train models that not only outperform other leading

articles.title: Adobe’s experimental AI tool can edit entire videos using one frame
articles.summary: Adobe demonstrated some of the experimental AI tools it’s working on at its Max conference that provide new ways to intuitively edit photos, videos, and audio. articles.title: Perplexity’s new AI tool aims to simplify patent research
articles.summary: Patents are notoriously difficult to search for, but Perplexity has launched an AI-powered tool that’s supposed to make the process a little easier. articles.title: Sora now lets you pay extra to make more AI videos
articles.summary: Keep burning through your video generation allowance on Sora? No problem, OpenAI now lets you buy extra credits to make even more AI videos. articles.title: Pinterest’s new AI shopping assistant helps you pick a fit
articles.summary: Move over Andy Sachs, Pinterest is launching an AI-enabled shopping assistant that aims to suggest your next look. articles.title: AI browsers are a cybersecurity time bomb
articles.summary: Web browsers are getting awfully chatty. articles.title: Universal partners with AI startup Udio after settling copyright suit
articles.summary: Universal Music Group says it has made “industry-first strategic agreements” to “settle copyright infringement litigation” with AI startup Udio and license music for a new AI-powered music platform.
